revised_title: On the Disappearance of Some Spectral Lines and the Variations of Metallic Spectra Due to Mixed Vapours
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the spectra of various elements, particularly magnesium, in different conditions such as arc, spark, and flame. They observed the disappearance and appearance of spectral lines when elements were mixed, and discussed the implications of these findings for understanding the spectra of sunspots and the solar atmosphere.
